full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement**

**Title:** Office Relocation Services
**Reference Number:** PW-22-01010058
**Amendment Number:** 1
**Solicitation Number:** 5X001-22-0261
**Publication Date:** October 14, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** November 4, 2022, 2:00 PM EST

**Tender Information**

The Courts Administration Service (CAS) invites bids for Office Relocation Services on an "as and when" basis within the National Capital Region (NCR) to relocate their offices from three (3) locations: 90 Sparks Street, 200 Kent Street, and Pink Road.

The contract is expected to be awarded for a period of two (2) years, starting from December 1, 2022, with an option to extend for an additional two (2) one-year periods. The successful bidder will be required to provide relocation services on an "as and when" basis, with a potential maximum value of $X.

**Bid Process and Evaluation Criteria**

Interested bidders must comply with the requirements outlined in the bid solicitation package, including the mandatory technical evaluation criteria. A bid must be submitted in both English and French languages, and the responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award.

**Procurement Requirements**

* Note: This tender is not subject to the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), and Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA) due to the exclusions listed in the bid solicitation package.

However, this tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

* Security Requirements: The CAS requires the successful bidder to comply with the security requirements outlined in Part 6 of the bid solicitation package, including personnel and organization security screening, and security clauses. For more information, refer to the Contract Security Program of Public Works and Government Services Canada (http://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/esc-src/introduction-eng.html).

**Bid Submission and Contact Information**

Bids must be submitted electronically through the Canada Buys
